Key Match Events: Rookie Brayan Rocchio homered and drove in a career-high four runs
Tanner Bibee struck out six batters and earned the win
Cleveland's league-leading bullpen brought it home from there
Post-Match Reflections: Guardians manager Stephen Vogt praised rookie Brayan Rocchio for refocusing after a failed bunt attempt
Vogt said Rocchio is continuing to develop at the plate and is 'growing up' more and more every single day
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Guardians reduced their magic number to clinch the American League Central Division to 20 with 23 games remaining
Guardians starters over the last four games have gone at least six innings and allowed no more than one earned run each
Josh Naylor exited the game with acute back spasms, but was given a positive update by Vogt
Others: Cleveland scored a run in the second off Kansas City starter Brady Singer after Will Brennan and Kyle Manzardo opened the inning with back-to-back singles
